metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7552 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the gdk_pixbuf_flip function ingdk-pixbuf-scale.c in gdk-pixbuf 2.30.x allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted BMPfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.6
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.6
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.7-0ubuntu1.6').
